data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you keep facing forward, you will be happy with where you are in your life. When you take nine steps left, you are going straight in the direction you are going. When you take 9 steps right, you are taking 9 steps right. A person who faces backwards will likely be happy. Thus, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Be back at the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can take 4 steps around and back to the beginning. If you take 4 steps, you will take 6 steps. There is 4 - 4 = 2 more steps. Thus, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You did 7 steps and 1 step first and still do 5 steps the total. You repeat this until you end up at the starting point. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and take 5 steps by turning around and taking 9 steps. If you' rewind it, it looks like the first set of steps were. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
There are no turning around steps in this scenario. You do not turn left. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It takes 15 steps to turn right and 10 steps to turn right. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 2 steps to get back to the starting point. Take 6 steps to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The second sentence of the instructions has one step left and the third sentence has 6 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Take 2 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 5 steps. Take 2 steps and turn around and take 9 steps. Take 3 steps and turn around and take 9 steps. Take 3 steps, take 5 steps, turn around and take 7 steps. Take 3 steps do the 3 steps in the first method and the same thing as taking 3 steps in the first method. In summary, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The way to solve this problem is to change direction or direction and face forward. Take 1 step backward is an example of flipping directions. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, all of the steps come back to the starting point. Let’ s say you are facing left and you are a man. If you always face right, the first step to return will be take & 6 step backward. Taking the first step backward brings you back to the first step. If you always face left, the second step to reverse would be take & 6 step forward. There are 3 sets of 7 steps in this example. When you are face forward, it is the last time you come back from your starting point. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you keep facing forward during the workout, you always make it to the starting point. If you take 9 steps left, you go backward. If you take 10 steps left, you go forward. If you take 3 steps left, you take 3 right. If you take 4 steps right, you go forward. So, the answer is No.

Face forward while taking 3 steps forward is not the same as facing left. So, the answer is No.

When you take 3 steps right the first time, you always have to do it again in the same direction. The beginning is always facing away from where you originally walked. The starting point is facing towards the right. So, the answer is no.

Turn around and take 4 steps. Turn around and take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. So, the answer is No.

Turn about 90 degrees and you are back in the original shape. Turn right.

Take 7 steps. If you take 9 steps, then you are back at the starting place. The answer is Yes.

Take 1 step and return to starting point. Take 5 steps to turn right and take 1 step to turn right. So, the answer is no.

There is 6 steps to return to starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

In order to turn around, you first have to take 2 steps. While the previous instructions say you first take 10, now turn around so you are taking 11 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow the 3 steps to go down, yes, then you get as far as you can without falling. If you follow the 7 steps to go right, yes, then you get as far as you can without falling. So, the answer is Yes.

When you are facing forward, every time you turn you are facing the camera. If you move in this direction, always face forward. If you move in this direction, always face your feet at a right angle. If you move in this direction, always always move forward. If you move in this direction, always always face forward. It is only natural that the hands and feet would move in the opposite direction. So, the answer is No.

If you always face forward, you come back to the starting point. Take 7 steps backward. So, the answer is yes.

You are always facing forward and you want to return to your starting point. So, the answer is yes.

Turn right, take 5 steps, turn around. So, the answer is no.

Always face forward after the 3 steps backward instruction. The second set of instructions assumes you always face forward. So, the answer is yes.

When looking forward, you always want to face forward. When looking backward, you always want to look backward. If your starting point is on the left side of the room, then you always go to the right side of the room to the right side and make the same choice. So, the answer is No.

Backward moves forward the direction of the steps you are taking. Forward moves forward the direction of the steps your body is facing. So, the answer is no.

Doing the 5 steps backwards reverts you back to start a new exercise. The 4 steps backwards is equivalent to 3 steps forward. There were no step left and no step right. The 3 steps forward and 3 back forward are equivalent to a forward and back step. So, the answer is no.

Steps backward means to go backward by 3 feet. Steps forward means to go forward by one step. So, the answer is Yes.

If you always face forward, you can assume that you are going to be able to take 4 steps backward. If you take 2 steps backward, you are essentially going to be reverting to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you always face forward you can always go backward. If you always face downward you can only go forwards. If you ever go backwards you can't go forwards. If you ever go backwards you can't go right. If you ever go left you can only go right. So, the answer is Yes.
